title: Drawing, "Design for a Sofa", ca. 1760
medium: Pen and ink, brush and rose washes on cream laid paper
markings:
Water mark: Lily [Heawood 1454]
Three unidentified amorial stamps on verso
inscribed: Lower edge in pen and black ink: 6 pied with ruled lines and arrows.
provenance: Formerly in the collection of Leon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Sofa turned and fluted legs and wrap-around sides and wood trim is seen from the front. The trimis detailed with fluted acanthus volutes and in the center of the back trim there is a bud separated by two acanthus leaves from which hangs a swag.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Sofa", ca. 1760.
ca. 1760. Pen and ink, brush and rose washes on cream laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-205.
